# Support Hallie Ford Museum of Art

Since opening our doors in 1998, donors have played a pivotal role in helping Hallie Ford Museum of Art to thrive. If you value the role that Hallie Ford Museum of Art plays at Willamette University and in the local community and would like to lend your support to the museum, here are some ways to do so.

* * *

## Become a Member

By joining today, your membership supports the museum's continuing commitment to bring outstanding fine art and special related events to our area. Your membership also supports collections, education and community outreach. In thanks for your support, you will receive unlimited free admission, invitations to exhibition openings and special programs, and much more. All membership levels include monthly reciprocal attractions through [PAMA](memberships/nwaa/index.html) (with free admission for you and up to 3 guests). Memberships start at the [$35 for the individual level](https://engage.willamette.edu/page/33922/donate/1) while our [sponsor level](https://engage.willamette.edu/page/33922/donate/1) includes free admission to over 1000 museums and organizations participating in the North American Reciprocal Museum Program.

## About the Museum

The only liberal arts college art museum in the Northwest, the museum is located near the Oregon State Capitol in the heart of Salem, Oregon. The museum is a leader in the research on the art of the Northwest, with one of the most significant collections of Northwest art and a history of important publications and exhibitions. The [museum’s collections](collections/index.html) reflect the rich [Pacific Northwest](collections/pacific-nw/index.html) culture and explore the history of art around the world.
